dublin_core.dcvalue: Despite the abundance of past home care projects and the maturity of the technologies used there is no widespread dissemination as yet The absence of accepted standards and thus interoperability and the inadequate integration into transinstitutional health information systems tHIS are perceived as key factors Based on the respective literature and previous experiences in home care projects we propose an architectural model for home care as part of a transinstitutional health information system using the HL7 clinical document architecture CDA as well as the HL7 Arden Syntax for Medical Logic Systems In two short case studies we describe the practical realization of the architecture as well as first experiences Our work can be regarded as a first step towards an interoperable and in our view sustainable home care architecture based on a prominent document standard from the health information system domain
